DOC.brief_summary: Radiation therapy uses high-energy x-rays to damage tumor cells. Giving radiation during surgery followed by external-beam radiation to the entire breast may kill more tumor cells.The clinical trial is conducting to compare the effectiveness of radiation therapy during surgery and whole-breast radiation therapy in treating women who have undergone breast-conversing surgery for Intermediate or high grade ductal carcinoma in situ breast cancer.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Intra-operative Radiotherapy With Post-operative Radiotherapy for Women With Ductal Carcinoma in Situ
DOC.criteria: Tumor diameter < 5 cm Intermediate or high grade ductal carcinoma in situ Informed consent No informed consent Tumor size > 3,5 cm Low grade ductal carcinoma in situ Invasive carcinoma No indication for a boost
DOC.keyword: Intermediate and high grade ductal carcinoma in situ （DCIS）
